body_html:
@vrv yes, I didn't use the batch version of @mtourne. I updated tensorflow source code, compiled and reinstalled. Then I modified the original file convolutional.py with the above code I mentioned, thanks to your advice. It worked with my card (Titan Z) with 6 GB (obviously it runs only on one single GPU inside that duo card).

I also run the original file convolutional.py (with no modification) with the updated tensorflow source code and I got the same old Resource Exhaustion error

body:
@vrv yes, I didn't use the batch version of @mtourne. I updated tensorflow source code, compiled and reinstalled. Then I modified the original file convolutional.py with the above code I mentioned, thanks to your advice. It worked with my card (Titan Z) with 6 GB (obviously it runs only on one single GPU inside that duo card).

I also run the original file convolutional.py (with no modification) with the updated tensorflow source code and I got the same old Resource Exhaustion error
